Name: HMS Quail
Motto: 'I will be prompt at a signal'
Fate:
Damaged by a mine on 15 November 1943
sunk under tow on 18 May 1944
Badge: On a Field per fess Blue and Green, a quail White
Displacement:
1,692 tons (1,720 tonnes)
2,411 tons (2,449 tonnes) full load
Propulsion: 2 x Admiralty 3-drum water-tube boilers, Parsons geared steam turbines, 40,000 shp (30,000 kW) on 2 shafts
processing systems:
Radar Type 290 air warning
Radar Type 285 ranging & bearing
Armament:
4 × QF 4.7 in Mk.XII (119 mm L/45) on single mounts CP Mk.XVIII
4 × QF 2 pdr Mk.VIII (40 mm L/39), quad mount Mk.VII
6 × QF 20 mm Oerlikon, single mount P Mk.III
8 (2x4) tubes for 21 in torpedoes  Mk.IX
up to 3 x throwers & 3 x racks, to 45 depth charges
